Thaw SQB, LB, FLT and a fresh tube of FB at

Mix SQB, FB and FLT by vortexing, spin down using a microfuge and place

Open the lid of the MinION. Slide the MinION SpotON flow cell under the MinION clip.

Rotate open the priming port cover.
Place a P1000 pipette tip (pipette set to 200 μL) upright in the priming port.
Slowly turn the volume dial to ~220 μL. There should be a small volume of yellow buffer in the pipette tip.
Still holding the pipette in an upright position, swiftly and smoothly lift the pipette out of the priming port.

Add
directly to a fresh tube of FB to make the flow cell priming mix.
Vortex to mix.

Load
of the priming mix into the priming port:
Hold the pipette upright in the priming port and turn the dial to gradually to force the priming mix into the flow cell.
(To avoid the introduction of air, you may need to turn the dial a small amount in the opposite direction to draw up some of the flow cell buffer and establish liquid-to-liquid contact between the buffer and priming mix.)
Wait for
.
Thoroughly mix LB to resuspend the beads by pipetting.

In an Eppendorf LoBind tube, mix:
(freshly mixed)

Lift the SpotON sample port cover and load an additional
of the priming mix into the still open priming port.
Mix the loading library by slowly pipetting to resuspend the loading beads.

Slowly, drop
loading library into the SpotON sample port.
Make sure the priming port is still open during this step and the library should easily fall into the sample port.

Close the priming port and replace the SpotON sample port cover.
Close the lid of the MinION device.
Start the sequencing experiment on the MinKNOW software.

Check the number of pores on the flow cell by navigating to and selecting Flow Cell Check on the MinKNOW software. This should take approximately
.

description: Protocol for ligation sequencing DNA library prep for MinION slightly modified from the ONT protocol.
